I just turned down a guaranteed job offer. It was a contract-to-hire situation where I would be eligible for benefits and a full-time salary after 6 months. The downside was a 2 hour commute every day, and not really my ideal position. On top of that, I'm expecting to hear back from another job tomorrow that would be more of what I actually wanted to do, and would be direct-hire and only a 15-30 minute commute a day. I was honest with the recruiter about the other job, and he informed me that I had to make a decision right then and there. Not much time to think about it. The recruiter seemed puzzled when I respectfully declined. Yes, I am aware that there is a fair chance that I won't get the job I actually want and be back to square one, but I still felt pretty good about not compromising my time away from my family and keeping my integrity in tact. I know they say you should take whatever comes at you so you can "get your foot in the door", but I've been a part of the work force a very long time. I think I've earned the right to hold out for the job I truly want.

Productive Data Solutions (PDS) is a full-service Information Technology (IT) Consulting, Staffing, and Project-based Solutions company. Since 1987, PDS has been providing IT Strategy & Planning, Software & Database, Network & Infrastructure, QA & Testing, and Support & Management IT services. We have the ability to rapidly increase the capacity of our project teams by leveraging over two decades of local and national recruiting experience and expertise.Our clients range from Fortune 500 corporations to federal, state, and local governments, as well as small-cap businesses in nearly every major industry sector.Over the years, we have been recognized with numerous awards for outstanding service and successful growth. We are fully committed to developing mutually rewarding relationships indefinitely.

December 13, 2016, David was a client of Daniel’s

I had the opportunity to connect with Daniel in April of 2016; at that time I had just been laid off from my position and was ready to get back into the job market as soon as possible. Daniel contacted me and spoke with me about my career goals, my background, and what it was that I was looking for to help get me back on my feet. He worked diligently to find a position for me and when an opportunity became available he contacted me right away. Fortunately enough, thanks in part to Daniels efforts, I was able to land the position and get back into the workforce right away.Since that time I have maintained that position and Daniel has been in consistent contact with me, checking in to see how things are progressing and to make sure that I have everything I need. When the need arises I do not hesitate to recommend Daniel to anyone and everyone that I know that is in the market for a new opportunity. I greatly appreciate Daniel, and the entire team at PDS, for all of the hard work and dedication they put into to making sure their clients are well taken care of at all times.

Technical Project Management / Business Analyst  Professional
June 25, 2014, Stacey worked with Daniel but at different companies

I had the pleasure of connecting with Daniel back in 2012 while he was a Resource Manager with Signature Consultants.  As a consultant looking to find the right opportunity, I found Daniel to be a very effective communicator in determining my requirements and matching my skill set with client needs.  He made me feel just as important as the client because he took the time to follow up with me consistently and ask additional questions.  His professionalism and interpersonal skills are what made him stand out from other recruiters.  He worked diligently to find me an opportunity when the market had seen better days.  Daniel is an A+ recruiter who I will always make sure has my updated resume.

David is one of the most successful candidates I have ever worked with. A client-manager we support highly recommended him to us when he was searching. Once the right opportunity presented itself, a Project Coordinator role at ADOT, he got the job. This was in April of this year. Between then and now, David's work ethic, accountability, leadership, and management skills have earned him a Project Management spot within the organization. He has consistently received glowing reviews and the fast-paced addition of responsibilities in such a short amount of time is attributed to his overall character. David is a true IT Professional!
